title: datalad save -m msg LOTSOFDIRS  is cpu bound

labels.name: performance
labels.description: Improve performance of an existing feature

body:
```shell
/data/R03/WM-R03/analyses/1st-level$ datalad --version
datalad 0.12.0rc4.dev153
```

With  `-d^` - it seems first  to redo some query over and over again:
```shell
/data/R03/WM-R03/analyses/1st-level$ DATALAD_LOG_TRACEBACK=6 datalad -l debug save -d^ -m "Adding all the reg_standard/ subdirs which FSL generated" $PWD/*/reg_standard
...

```

Not using `-d^` seems to avoid that part of dance and then just gets cpu bound (without any log messages or external child command running) after
```
[Level 9] ...>gitrepo:327,1839,1876>cmd:698,487,611  Running: ['git', 'show', '-z', '--no-patch', '--format=%H', '--']
[Level 8] ...>gitrepo:327,1839,1876>cmd:698,556,611  Finished running ['git', 'show', '-z', '--no-patch', '--format=%H', '--'] with status 0
[DEBUG  ] ...>utils:520>status:370,116>gitrepo:3145,3181,2866  <AnnexRepo path=/data/R03/WM-R03/analyses/1st-level (<class 'datalad.support.annexrepo.AnnexRepo'>)>.get_content_info(...)
[Level 8] ...>gitrepo:3145,3181,2882>annexrepo:2413>gitrepo:1271,839  Using existing Git repository at /data/R03/WM-R03/analyses/1st-level
[DEBUG  ] ...>utils:520>status:370,116>gitrepo:3145,3181,2906  Query repo: ['git', 'ls-files', '--stage', '-z', '-d', '-m', '--exclude-standard', '-o']
[Level 9] ...>gitrepo:327,1839,1876>cmd:698,487,611  Running: ['git', 'ls-files', '--stage', '-z', '-d', '-m', '--exclude-standard', '-o']
[Level 8] ...>gitrepo:327,1839,1876>cmd:698,556,611  Finished running ['git', 'ls-files', '--stage', '-z', '-d', '-m', '--exclude-standard', '-o'] with status 0
[DEBUG  ] ...>utils:520>status:370,116>gitrepo:3145,3181,2927  Done query repo: ['git', 'ls-files', '--stage', '-z', '-d', '-m', '--exclude-standard', '-o']
```
doing something -- my wild guess is -- parsing output of listed above git commands, who knows (having more log messages about an intended/to be happened activity would be super useful IMHO).  
To give a sense of consumed time (I didn't time it) I guess I will just keep mumbling here in this issue until that command proceeds somewhere beyond that point,... oh well, I was just kidding since we do not have full day to just keep typing... still running, I better go do something useful in hope that it would complete today, later, may be, without crashing.
